27#include <sys/cdefs.h>
28__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: radeon_uvd_v1_0.c,v 1.1 2018/08/27 14:38:20 riastradh Exp $");
29
30#include <linux/firmware.h>
31#include <drm/drmP.h>
32#include "radeon.h"
33#include "radeon_asic.h"
34#include "r600d.h"
35
36/**
37 * uvd_v1_0_get_rptr - get read pointer
38 *
39 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
40 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
41 *
42 * Returns the current hardware read pointer
43 */
44uint32_t uvd_v1_0_get_rptr(struct radeon_device *rdev,
45 struct radeon_ring *ring)
46{
47 return RREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_RPTR);
48}
49
50/**
51 * uvd_v1_0_get_wptr - get write pointer
52 *
53 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
54 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
55 *
56 * Returns the current hardware write pointer
57 */
58uint32_t uvd_v1_0_get_wptr(struct radeon_device *rdev,
59 struct radeon_ring *ring)
60{
61 return RREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_WPTR);
62}
63
64/**
65 * uvd_v1_0_set_wptr - set write pointer
66 *
67 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
68 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
69 *
70 * Commits the write pointer to the hardware
71 */
72void uvd_v1_0_set_wptr(struct radeon_device *rdev,
73 struct radeon_ring *ring)
74{
75 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_WPTR, ring->wptr);
76}
77
78/**
79 * uvd_v1_0_fence_emit - emit an fence & trap command
80 *
81 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
82 * @fence: fence to emit
83 *
84 * Write a fence and a trap command to the ring.
85 */
86void uvd_v1_0_fence_emit(struct radeon_device *rdev,
87 struct radeon_fence *fence)
88{
89 struct radeon_ring *ring = &rdev->ring[fence->ring];
90 uint64_t addr = rdev->fence_drv[fence->ring].gpu_addr;
91
92 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_DATA0, 0));
93 radeon_ring_write(ring, addr & 0xffffffff);
94 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_DATA1, 0));
95 radeon_ring_write(ring, fence->seq);
96 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_CMD, 0));
97 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0);
98
99 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_DATA0, 0));
100 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0);
101 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_DATA1, 0));
102 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0);
103 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_GPCOM_VCPU_CMD, 0));
104 radeon_ring_write(ring, 2);
105 return;
106}
107
108/**
109 * uvd_v1_0_resume - memory controller programming
110 *
111 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
112 *
113 * Let the UVD memory controller know it's offsets
114 */
115int uvd_v1_0_resume(struct radeon_device *rdev)
116{
117 uint64_t addr;
118 uint32_t size;
119 int r;
120
121 r = radeon_uvd_resume(rdev);
122 if (r)
123 return r;
124
125 /* programm the VCPU memory controller bits 0-27 */
126 addr = (rdev->uvd.gpu_addr >> 3) + 16;
127 size = RADEON_GPU_PAGE_ALIGN(rdev->uvd_fw->size) >> 3;
128 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_OFFSET0, addr);
129 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_SIZE0, size);
130
131 addr += size;
132 size = RADEON_UVD_STACK_SIZE >> 3;
133 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_OFFSET1, addr);
134 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_SIZE1, size);
135
136 addr += size;
137 size = RADEON_UVD_HEAP_SIZE >> 3;
138 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_OFFSET2, addr);
139 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CACHE_SIZE2, size);
140
141 /* bits 28-31 */
142 addr = (rdev->uvd.gpu_addr >> 28) & 0xF;
143 WREG32(UVD_LMI_ADDR_EXT, (addr << 12) | (addr << 0));
144
145 /* bits 32-39 */
146 addr = (rdev->uvd.gpu_addr >> 32) & 0xFF;
147 WREG32(UVD_LMI_EXT40_ADDR, addr | (0x9 << 16) | (0x1 << 31));
148
149 WREG32(UVD_FW_START, *((uint32_t*)rdev->uvd.cpu_addr));
150
151 return 0;
152}
153
154/**
155 * uvd_v1_0_init - start and test UVD block
156 *
157 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
158 *
159 * Initialize the hardware, boot up the VCPU and do some testing
160 */
161int uvd_v1_0_init(struct radeon_device *rdev)
162{
163 struct radeon_ring *ring = &rdev->ring[R600_RING_TYPE_UVD_INDEX];
164 uint32_t tmp;
165 int r;
166
167 /* raise clocks while booting up the VCPU */
168 if (rdev->family < CHIP_RV740)
169 radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 10000, 10000);
170 else
171 radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 53300, 40000);
172
173 r = uvd_v1_0_start(rdev);
174 if (r)
175 goto done;
176
177 ring->ready = true;
178 r = radeon_ring_test(rdev, R600_RING_TYPE_UVD_INDEX, ring);
179 if (r) {
180 ring->ready = false;
181 goto done;
182 }
183
184 r = radeon_ring_lock(rdev, ring, 10);
185 if (r) {
186 DRM_ERROR("radeon: ring failed to lock UVD ring (%d).\n", r);
187 goto done;
188 }
189
190 tmp = PACKET0(UVD_SEMA_WAIT_FAULT_TIMEOUT_CNTL, 0);
191 radeon_ring_write(ring, tmp);
192 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0xFFFFF);
193
194 tmp = PACKET0(UVD_SEMA_WAIT_INCOMPLETE_TIMEOUT_CNTL, 0);
195 radeon_ring_write(ring, tmp);
196 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0xFFFFF);
197
198 tmp = PACKET0(UVD_SEMA_SIGNAL_INCOMPLETE_TIMEOUT_CNTL, 0);
199 radeon_ring_write(ring, tmp);
200 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0xFFFFF);
201
202 /* Clear timeout status bits */
203 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_SEMA_TIMEOUT_STATUS, 0));
204 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0x8);
205
206 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_SEMA_CNTL, 0));
207 radeon_ring_write(ring, 3);
208
209 radeon_ring_unlock_commit(rdev, ring, false);
210
211done:
212 /* lower clocks again */
213 radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 0, 0);
214
215 if (!r) {
216 switch (rdev->family) {
217 case CHIP_RV610:
218 case CHIP_RV630:
219 case CHIP_RV620:
220 /* 64byte granularity workaround */
221 WREG32(MC_CONFIG, 0);
222 WREG32(MC_CONFIG, 1 << 4);
223 WREG32(RS_DQ_RD_RET_CONF, 0x3f);
224 WREG32(MC_CONFIG, 0x1f);
225
226 /* fall through */
227 case CHIP_RV670:
228 case CHIP_RV635:
229
230 /* write clean workaround */
231 WREG32_P(UVD_VCPU_CNTL, 0x10, ~0x10);
232 break;
233
234 default:
235 /* TODO: Do we need more? */
236 break;
237 }
238
239 DRM_INFO("UVD initialized successfully.\n");
240 }
241
242 return r;
243}
244
245/**
246 * uvd_v1_0_fini - stop the hardware block
247 *
248 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
249 *
250 * Stop the UVD block, mark ring as not ready any more
251 */
252void uvd_v1_0_fini(struct radeon_device *rdev)
253{
254 struct radeon_ring *ring = &rdev->ring[R600_RING_TYPE_UVD_INDEX];
255
256 uvd_v1_0_stop(rdev);
257 ring->ready = false;
258}
259
260/**
261 * uvd_v1_0_start - start UVD block
262 *
263 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
264 *
265 * Setup and start the UVD block
266 */
267int uvd_v1_0_start(struct radeon_device *rdev)
268{
269 struct radeon_ring *ring = &rdev->ring[R600_RING_TYPE_UVD_INDEX];
270 uint32_t rb_bufsz;
271 int i, j, r;
272
273 /* disable byte swapping */
274 u32 lmi_swap_cntl = 0;
275 u32 mp_swap_cntl = 0;
276
277 /* disable clock gating */
278 WREG32(UVD_CGC_GATE, 0);
279
280 /* disable interupt */
281 WREG32_P(UVD_MASTINT_EN, 0, ~(1 << 1));
282
283 /* Stall UMC and register bus before resetting VCPU */
284 WREG32_P(UVD_LMI_CTRL2, 1 << 8, ~(1 << 8));
285 WREG32_P(UVD_RB_ARB_CTRL, 1 << 3, ~(1 << 3));
286 mdelay(1);
287
288 /* put LMI, VCPU, RBC etc... into reset */
289 WREG32(UVD_SOFT_RESET, LMI_SOFT_RESET | VCPU_SOFT_RESET |
290 LBSI_SOFT_RESET | RBC_SOFT_RESET | CSM_SOFT_RESET |
291 CXW_SOFT_RESET | TAP_SOFT_RESET | LMI_UMC_SOFT_RESET);
292 mdelay(5);
293
294 /* take UVD block out of reset */
295 WREG32_P(SRBM_SOFT_RESET, 0, ~SOFT_RESET_UVD);
296 mdelay(5);
297
298 /* initialize UVD memory controller */
299 WREG32(UVD_LMI_CTRL, 0x40 | (1 << 8) | (1 << 13) |
300 (1 << 21) | (1 << 9) | (1 << 20));
301
302#ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
303 /* swap (8 in 32) RB and IB */
304 lmi_swap_cntl = 0xa;
305 mp_swap_cntl = 0;
306#endif
307 WREG32(UVD_LMI_SWAP_CNTL, lmi_swap_cntl);
308 WREG32(UVD_MP_SWAP_CNTL, mp_swap_cntl);
309
310 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_MUXA0, 0x40c2040);
311 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_MUXA1, 0x0);
312 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_MUXB0, 0x40c2040);
313 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_MUXB1, 0x0);
314 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_ALU, 0);
315 WREG32(UVD_MPC_SET_MUX, 0x88);
316
317 /* take all subblocks out of reset, except VCPU */
318 WREG32(UVD_SOFT_RESET, VCPU_SOFT_RESET);
319 mdelay(5);
320
321 /* enable VCPU clock */
322 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CNTL, 1 << 9);
323
324 /* enable UMC */
325 WREG32_P(UVD_LMI_CTRL2, 0, ~(1 << 8));
326
327 WREG32_P(UVD_RB_ARB_CTRL, 0, ~(1 << 3));
328
329 /* boot up the VCPU */
330 WREG32(UVD_SOFT_RESET, 0);
331 mdelay(10);
332
333 for (i = 0; i < 10; ++i) {
334 uint32_t status;
335 for (j = 0; j < 100; ++j) {
336 status = RREG32(UVD_STATUS);
337 if (status & 2)
338 break;
339 mdelay(10);
340 }
341 r = 0;
342 if (status & 2)
343 break;
344
345 DRM_ERROR("UVD not responding, trying to reset the VCPU!!!\n");
346 WREG32_P(UVD_SOFT_RESET, VCPU_SOFT_RESET, ~VCPU_SOFT_RESET);
347 mdelay(10);
348 WREG32_P(UVD_SOFT_RESET, 0, ~VCPU_SOFT_RESET);
349 mdelay(10);
350 r = -1;
351 }
352
353 if (r) {
354 DRM_ERROR("UVD not responding, giving up!!!\n");
355 return r;
356 }
357
358 /* enable interupt */
359 WREG32_P(UVD_MASTINT_EN, 3<<1, ~(3 << 1));
360
361 /* force RBC into idle state */
362 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_CNTL, 0x11010101);
363
364 /* Set the write pointer delay */
365 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_WPTR_CNTL, 0);
366
367 /* programm the 4GB memory segment for rptr and ring buffer */
368 WREG32(UVD_LMI_EXT40_ADDR, upper_32_bits(ring->gpu_addr) |
369 (0x7 << 16) | (0x1 << 31));
370
371 /* Initialize the ring buffer's read and write pointers */
372 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_RPTR, 0x0);
373
374 ring->wptr = RREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_RPTR);
375 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_WPTR, ring->wptr);
376
377 /* set the ring address */
378 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_BASE, ring->gpu_addr);
379
380 /* Set ring buffer size */
381 rb_bufsz = order_base_2(ring->ring_size);
382 rb_bufsz = (0x1 << 8) | rb_bufsz;
383 WREG32_P(UVD_RBC_RB_CNTL, rb_bufsz, ~0x11f1f);
384
385 return 0;
386}
387
388/**
389 * uvd_v1_0_stop - stop UVD block
390 *
391 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
392 *
393 * stop the UVD block
394 */
395void uvd_v1_0_stop(struct radeon_device *rdev)
396{
397 /* force RBC into idle state */
398 WREG32(UVD_RBC_RB_CNTL, 0x11010101);
399
400 /* Stall UMC and register bus before resetting VCPU */
401 WREG32_P(UVD_LMI_CTRL2, 1 << 8, ~(1 << 8));
402 WREG32_P(UVD_RB_ARB_CTRL, 1 << 3, ~(1 << 3));
403 mdelay(1);
404
405 /* put VCPU into reset */
406 WREG32(UVD_SOFT_RESET, VCPU_SOFT_RESET);
407 mdelay(5);
408
409 /* disable VCPU clock */
410 WREG32(UVD_VCPU_CNTL, 0x0);
411
412 /* Unstall UMC and register bus */
413 WREG32_P(UVD_LMI_CTRL2, 0, ~(1 << 8));
414 WREG32_P(UVD_RB_ARB_CTRL, 0, ~(1 << 3));
415}
416
417/**
418 * uvd_v1_0_ring_test - register write test
419 *
420 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
421 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
422 *
423 * Test if we can successfully write to the context register
424 */
425int uvd_v1_0_ring_test(struct radeon_device *rdev, struct radeon_ring *ring)
426{
427 uint32_t tmp = 0;
428 unsigned i;
429 int r;
430
431 WREG32(UVD_CONTEXT_ID, 0xCAFEDEAD);
432 r = radeon_ring_lock(rdev, ring, 3);
433 if (r) {
434 DRM_ERROR("radeon: cp failed to lock ring %d (%d).\n",
435 ring->idx, r);
436 return r;
437 }
438 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_CONTEXT_ID, 0));
439 radeon_ring_write(ring, 0xDEADBEEF);
440 radeon_ring_unlock_commit(rdev, ring, false);
441 for (i = 0; i < rdev->usec_timeout; i++) {
442 tmp = RREG32(UVD_CONTEXT_ID);
443 if (tmp == 0xDEADBEEF)
444 break;
445 DRM_UDELAY(1);
446 }
447
448 if (i < rdev->usec_timeout) {
449 DRM_INFO("ring test on %d succeeded in %d usecs\n",
450 ring->idx, i);
451 } else {
452 DRM_ERROR("radeon: ring %d test failed (0x%08X)\n",
453 ring->idx, tmp);
454 r = -EINVAL;
455 }
456 return r;
457}
458
459/**
460 * uvd_v1_0_semaphore_emit - emit semaphore command
461 *
462 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
463 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
464 * @semaphore: semaphore to emit commands for
465 * @emit_wait: true if we should emit a wait command
466 *
467 * Emit a semaphore command (either wait or signal) to the UVD ring.
468 */
469bool uvd_v1_0_semaphore_emit(struct radeon_device *rdev,
470 struct radeon_ring *ring,
471 struct radeon_semaphore *semaphore,
472 bool emit_wait)
473{
474 /* disable semaphores for UVD V1 hardware */
475 return false;
476}
477
478/**
479 * uvd_v1_0_ib_execute - execute indirect buffer
480 *
481 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
482 * @ib: indirect buffer to execute
483 *
484 * Write ring commands to execute the indirect buffer
485 */
486void uvd_v1_0_ib_execute(struct radeon_device *rdev, struct radeon_ib *ib)
487{
488 struct radeon_ring *ring = &rdev->ring[ib->ring];
489
490 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_RBC_IB_BASE, 0));
491 radeon_ring_write(ring, ib->gpu_addr);
492 radeon_ring_write(ring, PACKET0(UVD_RBC_IB_SIZE, 0));
493 radeon_ring_write(ring, ib->length_dw);
494}
495
496/**
497 * uvd_v1_0_ib_test - test ib execution
498 *
499 * @rdev: radeon_device pointer
500 * @ring: radeon_ring pointer
501 *
502 * Test if we can successfully execute an IB
503 */
504int uvd_v1_0_ib_test(struct radeon_device *rdev, struct radeon_ring *ring)
505{
506 struct radeon_fence *fence = NULL;
507 int r;
508
509 if (rdev->family < CHIP_RV740)
510 r = radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 10000, 10000);
511 else
512 r = radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 53300, 40000);
513 if (r) {
514 DRM_ERROR("radeon: failed to raise UVD clocks (%d).\n", r);
515 return r;
516 }
517
518 r = radeon_uvd_get_create_msg(rdev, ring->idx, 1, NULL);
519 if (r) {
520 DRM_ERROR("radeon: failed to get create msg (%d).\n", r);
521 goto error;
522 }
523
524 r = radeon_uvd_get_destroy_msg(rdev, ring->idx, 1, &fence);
525 if (r) {
526 DRM_ERROR("radeon: failed to get destroy ib (%d).\n", r);
527 goto error;
528 }
529
530 r = radeon_fence_wait(fence, false);
531 if (r) {
532 DRM_ERROR("radeon: fence wait failed (%d).\n", r);
533 goto error;
534 }
535 DRM_INFO("ib test on ring %d succeeded\n", ring->idx);
536error:
537 radeon_fence_unref(&fence);
538 radeon_set_uvd_clocks(rdev, 0, 0);
539 return r;
540}
